intro: Psychotria speciosa var. longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
